content.description: A purported bolted routes goes up the highest part of the face, no bolts now seen. I you do find a bolt ..... don't trust it !!! .... bolts are probably rotten from road salt corrosion and are untrustworthy.
content.location: Left of center between 2 "ribs" from the highest point in the middle of rock face.

content.description: A 80 ft high Roadcut along highway 30 near the southern tip of Tupper Lake, easy parking across from the roadcut. The rock is coarse and grippy, the rock face is almost vertical but does have some features to climb on. No bolts seen, although old 1/4" bolts have been reported. If you do find bolts DON'T TRUST THEM ... they are rotten and completely untrustworthy. Bolt degradation is probably due to road salt, similar to salt water ocean corrosion.
